<title level="1" right="Archetype 6" pfs="Limited">[Bellflower Tiller](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=23)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Age of Ashes</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

**Source** [Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn](/Sources.aspx?ID=8) pg. 75

Bellflower tillers handle most of the ground-level efforts of freeing slaves and escorting them to safety. They use farming-related code words to hide their work: a tiller’s freed slaves are her “crop,” which she moves along secretive paths termed “rows,” taking shelter in secret hideouts referred to as “barns.”

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
